package ImpliciExplict;

import java.util.Scanner;


public class ImplictExplict {

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		// TODO Auto-generated method stub
		Scanner sc=new Scanner(System.in);
		System.out.println("Implicit function & EXlpicit function ");
		System.out.println();
		System.out.println("Enter a integer value");
		int num1=sc.nextInt();
		System.out.println("num1 : "+num1);
		System.out.println("enter a double value");
		double num2=sc.nextInt();
		System.out.println("num2 :"+num2);
		
		double Result1=num1+num2; //Implicitly adding both double and integer value to be a double value result
		System.out.println();
		System.out.println("Result by doing imlplicit of num1 and num2 "+Result1);
		System.out.println();
		int Result2=(int)(num1+num2); //Explicitly adding both double and integer value to be an integer result
		System.out.println();
		System.out.println("Result by doing Explicit of num1 and num2 "+Result2);
		
	}

}
>>output>>
Implicit function & EXlpicit function 

Enter a integer value
123
num1 : 123
enter a double value
123
num2 :123.0

Result by doing imlplicit of num1 and num2 246.0


Result by doing Explicit of num1 and num2 246
